article_title: When It Comes To Its Reputation, The Pharmaceutical Industry Continues To Mess Up

article_metadata.description: If these two companies can do this, why can’t all do the same? If two of PhRMA’s biggest players have been doing this for years, why aren’t they all? The Affordable Health Care Act has been in effect for four years. It is not as if the industry didn’t see this coming. Rather than trying to work with CMS, BIO, PhRMA and AdvaMed should have been working with their member companies to mimic the transparency initiatives of Lilly and Pfizer. Such proactive behaviors would have made the Sunshine Act redundant and unnecessary.
article_metadata.author: John LaMattina
